Johnson  b: abt 1899 or 1900, 572485=June 13, 1927, 581932=February 7, 1845, 63490=In the fall of 1851 he emigrated from Ohio to Iowa and in the spring of 1852 came to Allen Co., Ind. with his parents.   He remained in Allen County until 1863 when he moved to Whitley County, and in the spring of 1864 settled on the present home farm.   On December 16, 1860 he was united in marriage to Hannah M. Oaks.   To this union were given 9 children, 6 girls and 3 boys.   These children are all living except one boy, Samuel, who died years ago.   He united with the M.E. Church at Churubusco, February 25th, 1894 under the pastorate of Rev. B. S. Hollopeter and was received into full membership, August 5th of the same year by Rev. J. M. Haines and remained a member of the same until his death.  , 236615=                                                        married Sept. 28, 1897 in Allen Co., IN, 417711=1969, 635487=September 10, 1883, Ohio , 36718=Abt 1844, 418913=1899, 85201=Abt 1898, 515224=November 18, 1912, 626117=June 4, 1958, 66752=Abt 1800, 181004=About 1822, 554410=March 1, 1821 ??  Marker hard to read, 455775=1953, 128521=Abt 1861, 230900=                        2.  John Johnson  b: 1837, 458980=1936, 314365=                                                3.  Nancy Johnson  b: March 31, 1841, 437631=1937, 43374=Abt 1859, 277832=Abt 1872, 287848=May 1848, 315274=                                                3.  Eliza Johnson  b: abt 1844  d: 1860, 450833=May 1, 1966     Krider records                   , 480545=1875, 516927=April 8, 1917, 414532=1983, 308445=Abt 1891, 247127=1850 Census of Eel River Township, Allen Co., IN, 407869=1924, 312129=                                                3.  James Johnson  b: 1835, 449228=1917, 507482=March 25, 1867  DAR, 598585=1984, 606421=July 9, 1927, 640386=1914, 424392=October 31, 1948, 310328=                        2.  John R. Johnson  b: Sept 10, 1874, 541584=1939, 450438=June 5, 1875, 327111=            He moved from Eel River Township in 1906 to Churubusco and lived there until coming to Fort Wayne in June 1913 at the time of his marriage to Jane Siegmund. They lived at 2914 Abbott Street until her death., 435396=February 6, 1925, 271869=Abt 1852, 323851=            Mr. Johnson is believed to have been one on the first white babies born in Eel River Township, on August 3, 1836, a son of MR. and MRS. JOHN R. JOHNSTON. His father and two of his father’s brothers, JOSEPH and DAVID JOHNSTON, are credited with having been among the first white men to settle on farmland of Allen County. They claimed farms in Eel River Township 100 years ago., 528339=1839, 471680=1884, 238315=                                                                        4.  Joseph Johnson  b: abt 1904, 103893=1891, 557666=February 7, 1900  , 245616=                                                3.  Mary E. Johnson  b: 1891, 225846=1920 Census of Smith Twp., Whitley Co., IN, 67928=Abt 1823, 529930=DAR 1899, 594983=October 6, 1833, Ohio, 460276=November 9, 1852, 122279=Abt 1888, 440662=January 10, 1859, 551184=1930, 175210=About 1915, 262114=Born abt 1848, 316160=                                                3.  Emily Johnson  b: abt 1848, 233958=                                                3.  Anne Johnson  b: 1869  d: 1924, 453786=1867, 574159=April 19, 1881, 167478=About 1897, 165545=About 1894, 473666=December 18, 1937 ?, 499066=December 29, 1878, 320556=                                                                        4.  Emma Gladys Johnson  b: Oct 1, 1876, 76569=Born Nov 1872, 568549=October 9, 1946, 173277=About 1911, 616409=1877, 114533=About 1861, 5823=1780-1790       James, 140751=1920 Census of Eel River Twp., Allen Co., IN, 492736=July 19, 1945, 565306=August 12, 1890, 479275=November 13, 1932   Sonday records, 484220=November 16, 1959  Krider records }
textBeforeTable: It is located on the northwest corner of Taylor and Aetna Roads.   The earliest date was 1835 and the DAR read and published parts of this site in 1932.   The DAR book was used to make this volume a more complete burial information source.   This old burial site was formerly a Methodist Chapel burial site.   It no longer exists, nor does the chapel.      WATERSON - WESLEY CHAPEL - JOHNSON CEMETERY             _____________________________________________________________________________   He is an enterprising farmer;  has already taken steps toward breeding an improved grade of cattle, sheep and hogs, and intends a continuance of improvement as fast as circumstances will permit.   He is a friend to education, a supporter and advocate of good schools, and, as far as able, ever stands ready to aid in advancing general improvements for his county.   Peaceable, temperate, kind to his family and industrious;   better by far, would our communities be, could we have a greater number of citizens like WESLEY JOHNSTON.
